content: Could also define what a simplified ratio is

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A concise and relevant challenge that assesses frequency counting and formatted output.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Seems good enough for Fastest, and had some fun trying to have a nice solution for Shortest. Reverse might be fun too, while not too difficult.
Didn't check deep enough the test cases, but they seem ok and didn't have any issue with them while testing my code.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting. Good idea !

Output

* Please add to the end:

using the format:
[[count]][[letter]]{{ : }}[[count]][[letter]]{{ : }}…

Cases
* The current variations in the GCD used across the validators are too limited:

  • Tests: 1 in 1 case, 2 in 2 cases, 3 in 2 cases, 50 in 1 case

  • Validators: 1 in 1 case, 2 in 4 cases, 60 in 1 case
  
  Please modify the validators to cover a broader range of GCD values.

Thanks.

Better, but we need a bit more:

* Swap Test 2 and Validator 2.

* Test 3: Change all As to Es.

* Validator 3: Revise the input so that GCD is 4.

* Test 5: Revise the input so that
  • GCD is 4.
  • Minimum number of occurrences of any letter is NOT 4.
  • F, H, K, O, Q, S, T, U, V and X are included.
  • You may include other letters but do NOT use A.
  • Scramble the letters as you did before.

* Validator 5: Revise the input so that
  • GCD is 5.
  • Minimum number of occurrences of any letter is NOT 5.
  • F, H, I, P, S, V, W and X are included.
  • You may include other letters but do NOT use A.
  • Scramble the letters as you did before.

Thanks.

Nearly there!

At the moment, GCD = minimum number of occurrences of any letter in every case except Pair 1. In my previous comment, I specified that for Pair 5 the two numbers should be different. However, they're still equal in this revision.

Let's avoid changing the existing cases, and instead add one new pair of cases:

Test/Validator 7:
* GCD is 4 (Test) / 5 (Validator).
* Minimum number of occurrences of any letter must NOT be 4 (Test) / 5 (Validator).
* Use random letters.
* Scramble all letters.
* Use as many multiples as possible.

For example, in the new test, GCD = 4. Start by choosing the minimum number of occurrences of any letter, which must be a multiple of 4 but greater than 4, say, 8. Then ensure that some letter occurrence counts are not multiples of 8, e.g. 12, 20, 28. This guarantees that GCD ≠ minimum number of occurrences of any letter.

The same idea applies to the new validator. For example, you could use 10 + 10 + 15 + 15 + 20 + 30 = 100.

Thanks.

Ok, thanks!
Is this good now?
